pageTitle: Itinerary for Tuesday, September 20, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Tuesday, September 20, 2016:

New York, New York, United States

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Opening Plenary of the United Nations General Assembly.

General Assembly Hall, 2nd Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

• Open coverage for accredited media
• Live Stream


10:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the President of the Republic of Bulgaria, Rosen Plevneliev.

Room 1520, 15th Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Note for media:

• Photo Opportunity


1:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a luncheon given by the United Nations
Secretary-General.

General Assembly Hall, 2nd Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

• Closed to media
• Livestream of Opening Toast of the Secretary-General and the President of the United States


2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will address the United Nations General Assembly.

General Assembly Hall, 2nd Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

• Open coverage for accredited media
• Livestream available


3:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Leaders’ Summit on Refugees hosted by the President of the United States, Barack Obama.

Trusteeship Chamber, 2nd Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

• Pooled media coverage.
• Livestream available


4:40 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Press Briefing Room, S-237, 2nd Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Note for media:

• Open coverage for accredited media


6:50 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a reception on the occasion of the 2nd Anniversary of “He for She”.

Lobby, Ground Floor
Museum of Modern Art
New York City, New York

Note for media:

• Open coverage for accredited media


Media Appearance

2:00 p.m. Amanpour, CNN International


PMO Media Relations:
media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
